com.acrolinx.javasdk.gui.checking.inline.markings.offset

Interface OffsetMarkingList

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    ExtendedOffsetMarkingList
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    StyledTextOffsetMarkingList

    public interface OffsetMarkingList
    The OffsetMarkingList painting and holding a list of highlights created on the AbsoluteRanges in the document. This interface must be implemented for the integration.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static OffsetMarkingList NULL
      The NULL-OffsetMarkingList doing nothing.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void add(Key key, AbsoluteRange range, MarkingColor color, MarkingType markingType)
      Paints a new highlight to a Range in the applications view.
      OffsetMarkingIndex getIndex() 
      void reColor(Key key, MarkingColor newMarkingColor, MarkingType markingType)
      Recolors an already colored highlight.
      void remove(Key key)
      Removes a highlight for a key.

    • Field Detail

      • NULL

        static final OffsetMarkingList NULL
        The NULL-OffsetMarkingList doing nothing.

    • Method Detail

      • getIndex

        OffsetMarkingIndex getIndex()
        Returns:
        The OffsetMarkingIndex holing or calculating a mapping between key and absolute ranges in original document.

      • reColor

        void reColor(Key key,
           MarkingColor newMarkingColor,
           MarkingType markingType)
        Recolors an already colored highlight. In this case you could query the OffsetMarkingIndex for the Ranges and update the highlights.
        Parameters:
        key - The Key of the highlights to update.
        newMarkingColor - the new MarkingColor of the highlight
        markingType - The MarkingType if you cannot deal with colors directly. See: add(Key, AbsoluteRange, MarkingColor, MarkingType) and InlineCheckCallback.onBeforeMarking(Map)

      • remove

        void remove(Key key)
        Removes a highlight for a key.
        Parameters:
        key - The Key of the highlight to be removed.

      • add

        void add(Key key,
       AbsoluteRange range,
       MarkingColor color,
       MarkingType markingType)
        Paints a new highlight to a Range in the applications view. It has to store a mapping between the applications highlight and the Key. Often it is possible to store the key directly in the style of the highlight, like in swing or SWT.
        Parameters:
        key - The Key to be stored by side the new highlight.
        range - The Range in the document which should be highlighted.
        color - The MarkingColor of the new highlight.
        markingType - The MarkingType of the highlight. In most integration this could be ignored. In some cases the used colors have to be defined before highlighting. In this case you could override InlineCheckCallback.onBeforeMarking(Map) to define a mapping between MarkingType and MarkingColor and use at this point the MarkingType instead of the MarkingColor.
